snippet: President Dilma Rousseff called a Canadian intelligence agency’s surveillance of Brazil’s mining and energy ministry and a top Brazilian diplomat “unacceptable.”
abstract: Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff demands an explanation from Canada over revelations that a Canadian intelligence agency had spied on Brazil's mining and energy ministry and a top Brazilian diplomat; development contributes to festering resentment in Brazil over the targeting of the nation by foreign intelligence agencies.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and IAN AUSTEN
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Ian Austen from Ottawa.

lead_paragraph: President Dilma Rousseff called a Canadian intelligence agency’s surveillance of Brazil’s mining and energy ministry and a top Brazilian diplomat “unacceptable.”

headline.main: Brazil’s Leader Asks Canada to Explain Its Spying
headline.print_headline: Brazil Leader Asks Canada To Explain Its Spying
